column2: attested (with the genitive ending ''[[-o]]'' that displaces final ''-a'') in the word ''omentielmo'' "of our meeting". This "our" is plural inclusive.

column1: [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]] (it seems) improperly used it in the greeting "a star shines on the hour of our meeting": since he and the Elf he was speaking to constituted only two persons
column2: he should have used the ''dual'' inclusive instead. The correct form '''omentielvo''' occurs in some of the manuscripts of the Red Book.<ref>{{L|205|2}}</ref>
